question.text: What of the following is/are correct about Cycas?

options.text: Cycas has characteristic branched stems and pinnate leaves.
It is a dioecious plant, where male cones and megasporophylls bear on different trees.
Mycorrhizal associations are commonly found in the roots of Cycas.

solution.text:
Cycas, a small-sized tropical gymnosperm is a dioecious plant. In this microsporophyll are organized to form male cones are present on one plant and megasporophylls are organized on a different plant. Thus, male and female plants are different in Cycas.
Roots in Cycas have small specialised roots called coralloid roots are associated with N2 - fixing cyanobacteria. The stems are unbranched. Pinnate leaves persist for a few years.
